Team4450.Lib

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • Team4450.Lib.Util

  • public class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a set of utility functions.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Util.CustomLogger
      Configures and holds (static) classes for our custom logging system.

      Logging class for use by other classes to log though this custom logging scheme.

      Open a print stream that writes to the log file.

    • Field Detail

      • logPrintStream

        public static final java.io.PrintStream logPrintStream
        Open a print stream that writes to the log file. Example of use: exception.printStackTrace(Util.logPrintStream);

      • logger

        public static final java.util.logging.Logger logger
        Logging class for use by other classes to log though this custom logging scheme. All logging should be done by calls to methods on this class instance or with the convenience methods elsewhere in the Util class.

        Returns:

        Throws:

        Write message to console log with optional formatting and program location.
        Parameters:
        message - Message with optional format specifiers for listed parameters.
        parms - Parameter list matching format specifiers.

      • consoleLog

        public static void consoleLog()
        Write blank line with program location to the console log.

      • uncaughtException

        public static void uncaughtException(java.lang.Thread t,
                                     java.lang.Throwable e)
        Handler for uncaught exceptions. Records thread name and exception to log file.
        Parameters:
        t - Thread where exception was thrown.
        e - Exception that was thrown.

      • logException

        public static void logException(java.lang.Throwable e)
        Write exception message to DS console window and exception stack trace to log file.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception to log.

      • listCANDevices

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> listCANDevices()
        polls for received framing to determine if a device is present. This is meant to be used once initially (and not periodically) since this steals cached messages from the robot API.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of strings holding the names of devices we've found.

      • checkRange

        public static boolean checkRange(double value,
                                 double min,
                                 double max)
        Check a double value to be within a min/max range.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to test.
        min - Lowest valid value.
        max - Maximum valid value.
        Returns:
        True if value in range, false if not.

      • checkRange

        public static void checkRange(double value,
                              double min,
                              double max,
                              java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Check a double value to be within a min/max range. Throws exception with error message if not.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to test.
        min - Lowest valid value.
        max - Maximum valid value.
        errorMessage - Error message for exception.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:

        min - Lowest valid value.
        max - Maximum valid value.

                              java.lang.String errorMessage)

        Parameters:

        min - Lowest valid value.
        max - Maximum valid value.
        errorMessage - Error message for the exception.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • checkRange

        public static boolean checkRange(int value,
                                 int magnitude)
        Check an integer value to be in the range -magnitude to +magnitude.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to test.
        magnitude - Magnitude or +-range of valid values, always positive.
        Returns:
        True if value greater than or equal to -magnitude and less than or equal to + magnitude.
